CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In the Janssen group , a copolymer containing terthiophene was reported , which shows an increase in planarity packing and high mobility characteristics , and a diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative showed a PCE of 4.7% and a high hole mobility ( 0.04 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| copolymer containing terthiophene |
| diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| copolymer containing terthiophene |
| diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative |

Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In the Janssen group , a copolymer containing terthiophene was reported , which shows an increase in planarity packing and high mobility characteristics , and a diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative showed a PCE of 4.7% and a high hole mobility ( 0.04 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| copolymer containing terthiophene |
| shows an increase in planarity packing |
| high mobility characteristics |
| PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) |
| diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative |
| shows a PCE of 4.7% |
| high hole mobility |

| --- |

| diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative - PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency): 4.7%, high hole mobility: 0.04 cm^2 V^-1 S^-1 |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In the Janssen group , a copolymer containing terthiophene was reported , which shows an increase in planarity packing and high mobility characteristics , and a diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative showed a PCE of 4.7% and a high hole mobility ( 0.04 cm^2 V -1 S^-1 ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| copolymer containing terthiophene |
| shows an increase in planarity packing and high mobility characteristics |
| PCE of 4.7% |
| diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative |
| high hole mobility (0.04 cm^2 V^-1 S^-1) |

The first two property values are described as "an increase in planarity packing and high mobility characteristics" for the copolymer containing terthiophene. I assumed that "planarity packing" and "high mobility" are two separate properties, so I presented them as two different property values. If you consider them as a single property, you can merge them into one property value.

Similarly, "PCE of 4.7%" and "high hole mobility (0.04 cm^2 V^-1 S^-1)" are two separate property values for different entities (copolymer containing terthiophene and diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative, respectively).

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE of 4.7% |
| high hole mobility (0.04 cm^2 V^-1 S^-1) |

The first property value "an increase in planarity packing and high mobility characteristics" for the copolymer containing terthiophene does not clearly refer to a material property value, as it describes the behavior or effect of the material rather than a specific value. Similarly, "diketopyrrolopyrrole derivative" is a material entity, not a property value.
